p: Previous studies have suggested that dengue was associated with: (i) low socioeconomic status, low income and/or low education [ 33, 38, 43, 46â€“ 52], (ii) low literacy [ 39, 43], (iii) lack of knowledge about dengue [ 48, 53], (iv) presence of economically inactive people in the household (unemployed, students, house workers) [ 39, 47], (v) household crowding (number of people per room) [ 50, 53], (vi) poor housing (inadequate sewage and garbage disposal, lack of screens and air-conditioning) [ 33, 37, 46, 47], (vii) household density [ 38, 44], and (viii) type of housing (individual house versus apartments, large residential area) [ 43, 50, 54, 55].
